info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 11 at 6:08PM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Colorado...
San Juan River at Pagosa Springs affecting Archuleta County.
For the San Juan River...including Bluff, Pagosa Springs...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...San Juan River at Pagosa Springs.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 12.4 feet, Portions of the San Juan River Campground east of Pagosa Springs are beginning to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 PM MDT Saturday was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest near 12.5 feet this evening and fall below flood stage during the early morning hours and continue falling to 5.8 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.5 feet on 06/29/1927. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gjt.
The next statement will be issued Sunday evening at 915 PM MDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
